page.syntax: Output_String as C = CHRTRAN(C string_1,C string_2,C string_3)

argument.name: string_1
argument.description: Input String. A character string to translate.

argument.name: string_2
argument.description: Search Pattern. A character string as the same length as input string containing characters likely and unlikely to match Input_String.

argument.name: string_3
argument.description: Replace Pattern. A character string as the same length as Input_String containing the characters to substitute when a character in Search_Pattern matches a character in Input_String.

page.description: Replaces a portion of one string with another.
page.discussion: CHRTRAN() returns a character string where characters in Input_String that match those in Search_Pattern have been replaced with characters in the same position in Replace_Pattern. Case sensitive. Common uses include changing character values within either a global update or an append operation. CHRTRAN() is especially useful for blanking specific positions in fields and for changing formatting characters used within a character code.

section.description: Assume the HOMEPHONE field contains values such as "(102)345-6789" and "(304)567-8901". In the following expression, since only the parentheses specified in Search_Pattern match any values in HOMEPHONE, CHRTRAN() forms values using all the other characters from a HOMEPHONE value, plus the spaces included in the first and fifth position from Replace_Pattern.
For the records containing the values listed above, CHRTRAN() returns " 102 345-6789" and " 304 567-8901".
